thread.title: Man gets 6 years for unprovoked slaying of New Westminster senior - BC | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: Man gets 6 years for unprovoked slaying of New Westminster senior - BC | Globalnews.ca

author: Amy Judd
title: Man gets 6 years for unprovoked slaying of New Westminster senior - BC | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 2, 2017 8:40 am Man gets 6 years for unprovoked slaying of New Westminster senior By Amy Judd Online News Producer Global News 
Julien Levasseur in a court sketch. Global News What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - 
The man who killed a New Westminster senior almost two years ago has been sentenced. 
Twenty-four-year-old Julien Levasseur will spend six years in prison for the June 2015 slaying of Charan Dhandwar. 
The 79-year-old woman had been out for an evening walk on 8th Ave. when she was randomly attacked and killed in the street. 
Levasseur was arrested at the scene and charged with second-degree murder. 
He entered a guilty plea to a count of manslaughter. 
In 2015, the family of Dhandwar said in a statement that they “lost not only our mom but a wife and grandma.” © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
